result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Bert J. LaBarge Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bert J. LaBarge Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bert J. LaBarge Jr. was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Bert J. LaBarge Jr. was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:50 Defendant Bert J. LaBarge in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Schiek statement - defendant has made consistant payments - Moves to dismiss - Granted

3:55 p.m. Defendant Bert J. LaBarge in court, in custody.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lynch appears specially. Attorney Vorhees represented in past. Lynch was provided with paystubs showing wage withholding for child support from defendant's family. Sowinski statement. Court modifies to $5,000 signature bond. Adj. 3:58 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

1:33 p.m. Defendant Bert J. LaBarge in court, in custody via video.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states record. Right to counsel. Schiek statement to bond. Defendant states he is employed at LDF County Market. Came to court on wrong date. Schiek states no child support payments since August. Defendant states his employer told him they were deducting child support from payroll - his electronic pay stub states they are deducting. Court sets bond. Defendant states he contacted PD's office and was told he was ineligible. Defendant statement to bond. Adj. 1:39 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for February 26, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
per Connor @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO
terminated - regular

4:47 Defendant Bert J. LaBarge not in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No appearance by defendant - has active warrant in this case already- this will remain in effect -
Extradition Forecast
to reinstitute
to Reinstitute

4:01 p.m. Defendant Bert J. LaBarge not in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states defendant has not complied - State will be filing Motion to Rescind. Court authorizes warrant on defendant's non-appearance. Adj. 4:02 p.m.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notified Rachel - paid in full

3:56 p.m. Defendant Bert J. LaBarge not in court.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Sowinski statement that defendant is working for the tribe and has a case manager assigned; has been making regular monthly payments to child support and is current on child support payments. Sowinski states she is willing to contact case manager to arrange payment of fines. Court agrees that warrant to be issued at this time for non-payment of fine is counter-intuitive; underlying issues of child suppport take precedence at this time. Adj. 3:59 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

3:50 p.m. Defendant Bert J. LaBarge in court with attorney Mary Burns for John E Voorhees.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Defendant states he had interviewed with Paul Bunyan and has an interview tomorrow at LDF Smoke Shop. Sowinski statement that State will not rescind DPA as long as even small payments are made towards court costs and child support. Defendant has $100 cash to pay today. Court orders that $100 cash payment be made to child support today prior to leaving building - must provide copy of receipt to DA's office today. Court explains payment plan to defendant - no appearance necessary if formally entered into payment plan with Clerk of Court. Adj. 3:58 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

4:22 p.m. Defendant Bert J. LaBarge in court.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sowinski states that motion to rescind will be filed. Adj. 4:25 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
DPA
Defense Exhibit 1 (original retained in exhibit drawer)

2:12 p.m. Defendant Bert J. LaBarge in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. State moves to amend Counts 2 and 3 to misdemeanor failure to support - a Class A Misdemeanor - Granted. State moves to dismiss Counts 4, 5 and 6 - Granted. Deferred Entry of Judgment filed as to Count 1.  Defendant enters no contest pleas. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 and 3 and accepts agreement on Count 1 and defers entry of judgment as to Count 1. Defendant's Exhibit 1 marked (letters) Schiek/Voorhees/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence - Counts 2 and 3
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 daysor date provided by Court,  unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Remain current with child support/arrearage orders and payments.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 2:31 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

1:28 p.m. Defendant Bert J. LaBarge in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Voorhees as to non-appearance - Voorhees/Defendant states confusion with the way the defendant wrote date/time on calendar. Court quashes warrant - reinstates bond -   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State to file Information that will mirror complaint - Voorhees enters not guilty pleas to all counts.  Bail continued. Adj. 1:35 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

12:08 p.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees has no reason for defendant's non-appearance - State requests warrant - Court authorizes warrant.  Adj. 12:09 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

4:02 p.m .Defendant Bert J. LaBarge in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea - prelimin requested - time limits waived.
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 10:45 am.
